page.title: 01Wissey Valley near Cranwich
page.content: The Lowlying area is mainly arable and meadowland. On the rising ground therre are woodlands and plantations. The area to the Notth is Privately owned parkland with ornamental lakes around a now demolished Didlington Hall. A small estate village, with a church, of about 48 persons still exists. Little London, to the west near the village of Northwold, has a score or so cottages, whilst Cranwich, on the Thetford and Kings Lynn road, is a mere scattered dozen or so dwellings, although it retains its thatched church, parts dating from 13th Century. There are five mixed farms in the area and an intensive pig-rearing unit. The southern edge is plantation and abuts the extensive forestry commission area of Cranwich heath (Map ref 05760291) which is almost entirely covered by conifers.
